item.title: ネイト・シルバーは、2020年以降$70Mを調達した予測市場スタートアップのPolymarketにアドバイザーとして参加、自身のニュースレター「Substack」の制作は続ける（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Nate Silver joins Polymarket, a predictions market startup that has raised $70M since 2020, as an adviser; he'll continue to produce his Substack newsletter  —  - “Probabilities really matter when you're trying to make plans,” Silver said in a phone interview.

item.title: 米陪審団、亡命中国人実業家グオ・ウェングイを投資家詐取で有罪に。メディア会社GTVに絡む3つの訴因では無罪に（Michael Forsythe/New York Times）
item.description:
Michael Forsythe / New York Times:
A US jury finds exiled Chinese businessman Guo Wengui guilty of defrauding investors; he was found not guilty on three counts tied to his media company GTV  —  A federal jury found that Guo Wengui defrauded investors, many his own fervent supporters, of hundreds of millions of dollars.

item.title: 情報源WBDは、財務、ビジネス、プロダクションを含む部門にわたって〜1,000人の従業員をレイオフする予定、情報源：影響を受けるマックススタッフは10人未満（Jennifer Maas/Variety）
item.description:
Jennifer Maas / Variety:
Sources: WBD will lay off ~1,000 employees across sectors including finance, business affairs, and production; source: fewer than 10 Max staffers are affected  —  Sources tell Variety that nearly 1,000 employees will be laid off across a few sectors in a new cost-cutting move at WBD …

item.title: ジフ・デイヴィス傘下のMashable、Lifehacker、PC Magの編集組合が、ジェネレーティブAIによるレイオフや給与カットを禁止する暫定契約に合意（Andrew Deck/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Andrew Deck / Nieman Lab:
The editorial union at Ziff Davis' Mashable, Lifehacker, and PC Mag agrees to a tentative contract prohibiting layoffs or salary cuts due to generative AI  —  Ziff Davis can't lay off workers or decrease their salary due to generative AI, according to the tentative contract.

item.title: 情報筋ディズニーは視聴者のストリーミング視聴時間を増やすため、ポップアップライブチャンネルや、よりカスタマイズされたレコメンデーションなどの機能を開発中。
item.description:
Wall Street Journal:
Sources: Disney is working on features to increase the hours viewers spend on streaming, including pop-up live channels and more-tailored recommendations  —  Entertainment giant makes technical improvements meant to retain subscribers and encourage longer viewing sessions

item.title: Deezer、GoogleのGemini 1.5を搭載し、ユーザーがテキストプロンプトからプレイリストを作成できる「Playlist with AI」をベータ版で公開。
item.description:
Aisha Malik / TechCrunch:
Deezer debuts Playlist with AI in beta, where users can create playlists from text prompts, powered by Google's Gemini 1.5, following rivals' similar offerings  —  Deezer is the latest music streaming app to introduce an AI playlist feature.  The company announced on Monday that a select number …

item.title: 英国人1,500人を対象とした調査：7％がニュース購読料を支払い、87％がコンテンツに支払うよりも広告を好むと回答。
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
A survey of 1,500 Britons: 7% pay for news subscriptions, 87% say they prefer ads to paying for content; overall, respondents said only 5% of ads were relevant  —  Two-thirds of Britons expect to access online content about current affairs and their special interests without paying for it, according to new research.

item.title: オジー・メディアと創業者カルロス・ワトソンを詐欺罪で有罪にした陪審団。新興企業の財務や偽装取引について投資家に嘘をついたとして非難している（Jack Queen/Reuters）
item.description:
Jack Queen / Reuters:
A jury convicts Ozy Media and its founder Carlos Watson of fraud, in a case accusing them of lying to investors about the startup's finances and sham deals  —  Ozy Media and founder Carlos Watson were convicted of fraud by a Brooklyn federal jury on Tuesday, in a case accusing them of lying …

item.title: ガーディアンの日曜紙『オブザーバー』の編集長ポール・ウェブスターは、6年間指揮を執り、28年間同紙に在籍した後、秋に引退する予定だ（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
Paul Webster, the editor of The Guardian's Sunday newspaper The Observer, plans to retire in the fall after six years at the helm and 28 years at the paper  —  Paul Webster, the editor of The Observer, will retire from the Sunday newspaper this autumn.  —  Webster has been the editor …

item.title: ピート・ウェルズ氏は12年間務めたニューヨーク・タイムズ紙のレストラン評論家を退任。
item.description:
Pete Wells / New York Times:
Pete Wells steps down as the New York Times' restaurant critic after 12 years, citing the toll of the job on his health, but will stay at the paper  —  Pete Wells is moving on from his role as the Times restaurant critic, a job with many rewards and maybe too many courses.

item.title: TaboolaのCEOが、Apple NewsとApple Stocksのアプリ内でネイティブ広告を展開する契約をAppleと結んだと発表。
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Taboola's CEO says the company has struck a deal with Apple to power native advertising within the Apple News and Apple Stocks apps; TBLA stock jumps 9%+  —  - Taboola's effort to build trust with Apple across its various teams and stakeholders was “a multiyear process,'” Singolda said.

item.title: 調査アップル、Nvidia、Anthropicなどが、WSJ、NPR、BBCなどのYouTube動画のトランスクリプトを含むデータセットでAIを訓練した（Annie Gilbertson/Proof）
item.description:
Annie Gilbertson / Proof:
Investigation: Apple, Nvidia, Anthropic, and others trained their AI on a dataset that contained YouTube video transcripts, including from the WSJ, NPR, and BBC  —  AI companies are generally secretive about their sources of training data, but an investigation by Proof News found …

item.title: 2014年にMSNから英国の国営通信社に入社したピート・クリフトンPAメディア編集長は、2024年末で退任すると語った（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
PA Media Editor-in-Chief Pete Clifton says he is stepping down at the end of 2024, after joining the UK's national news agency in 2014 from MSN  —  PA Media editor-in-chief Pete Clifton has revealed he is stepping down at the end of this year after ten years heading up the UK's national news agency.

item.title: MSNBCモーニング・ジョーの司会者ジョー・スカーボローは、NBCの首脳部が月曜日に自分の番組を取りやめた後、「驚いた」「失望した」と語っている（Alex Weprin/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / The Hollywood Reporter:
MSNBC Morning Joe host Joe Scarborough says that he was “surprised” and “disappointed” after NBC leadership pulled his show on Monday  —  The MSNBC host returned to the channel Tuesday, saying he was “surprised” and “disappointed” by the decision to preempt his show Monday.

item.title: FIFAがクラブワールドカップのアメリカ、アジア、中東をカバーするメディア権の入札募集を開始、アップルとの契約案は事実上終了（Adam Crafton/New York Times）
item.description:
Adam Crafton / New York Times:
FIFA launches an invitation to tender for media rights covering Americas, Asia, and MENA for its Club World Cup, effectively ending its proposed deal with Apple  —  FIFA has launched an invitation to tender for media rights covering the Americas, Asia, and the Middle East & North Africa regions …
